docs.snippet: Jose Antonio Meade's race for Mexico's presidency so far has looked more like a slog through mud — a struggle to free himself from the scandal-stained reputation of the governing Institutional Revolutionary Party that chose the seemingly apo...

headline.print_headline: Mexico Candidate Fights Ruling Party's Tarnished Image
headline.main: Mexico Candidate Fights Ruling Party's Tarnished Image

docs.snippet: The Mexican government began handing out transit or humanitarian visas to people in a caravan of Central American migrants, and said the procession of 1,000 or so migrants that drew criticism from President Donald Trump had begun to disperse.

headline.print_headline: Mexico Starts Giving Caravan Migrants Transit Visas
headline.main: Mexico Starts Giving Caravan Migrants Transit Visas

docs.snippet: China on Wednesday vowed to impose measures of the "same strength" in response to a proposed U.S. tariff hike on $50 billion worth of Chinese goods in a spiraling technology dispute that has fueled fears it might set back the global economic recov...

headline.print_headline: China Vows 'Same Strength' Measures Against US Tariffs
headline.main: China Vows 'Same Strength' Measures Against US Tariffs

docs.snippet: Here’s what you need to know at the end of the day.

headline.main: Trade War, Facebook, YouTube: Your Wednesday Evening Briefing

docs.snippet: But no despot can be perfectly enlightened.
India on Tuesday withdrew rules to control "fake news" less than 24 hours after announcing them, following an outcry that the regulations could be used by the government to curb press freedom.

headline.print_headline: Factbox: Action by Asian Governments to Crack Down on 'Fake News'
headline.main: Factbox: Action by Asian Governments to Crack Down on 'Fake News'

docs.snippet: A top Syrian Kurdish politician suggested on Wednesday that the Kurdish-led Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF) and the Iraqi government could mount joint operations against Islamic State in the area on the border of the two countries.

headline.print_headline: Syrian Kurdish Leader Signals Possible Joint Action With Iraq
headline.main: Syrian Kurdish Leader Signals Possible Joint Action With Iraq

docs.snippet: The German military on Wednesday put a short-range air defence unit with about 450 soldiers under Dutch command, further deepening ties between the two NATO allies.

headline.print_headline: German Air Defence Unit Put Under Dutch Control as Military Ties Deepen
headline.main: German Air Defence Unit Put Under Dutch Control as Military Ties Deepen

docs.snippet: Your daily look at late-breaking news, upcoming events and the stories that will be talked about today:
Asian stock markets were mixed in early trading Wednesday as investors pondered the latest volley of tariff measures and threats between the U.S. and China.

headline.print_headline: Asian Shares Mixed as Markets Mull US Tariffs List for China
headline.main: Asian Shares Mixed as Markets Mull US Tariffs List for China
